meanings.definition: An estate held in absolute ownership, free from any feudal obligations.
meanings.sent1: The family inherited an alod from their ancestors.
meanings.sent2: The farmer's alod was passed down through generations.
meanings.sent3: The alod was so valuable that everyone in the village wanted to buy it.
meanings.sent4: Her alod was like a precious gem in the midst of ordinary stones.
meanings.sent5: The alod gleamed in the sunlight, a symbol of independence and pride.

meanings.definition: A piece of land held in allodial tenure.
meanings.sent1: The vast alod stretched as far as the eye could see.
meanings.sent2: The alod was fertile and perfect for growing crops.
meanings.sent3: The alod seemed to whisper secrets to those who walked its fields.
meanings.sent4: His alod was a sanctuary away from the chaos of the city.
meanings.sent5: The alod was a patchwork of colors, a painting created by nature.

meanings.definition: To grant or convey as an alod.
meanings.sent1: The king decided to alod the land to the loyal knight.
meanings.sent2: She aloded the property to her sister in the will.
meanings.sent3: The mayor aloded the park to the community for their use.
meanings.sent4: He aloded his favorite fishing spot to his grandson.
meanings.sent5: The wealthy merchant aloded his mansion to the town for a museum.
